a.commentary: I vanlig användning (både före och efter pu), är "a" och "kin" separata ord, var och en med sin egen mening. I pu betraktas de som synonymer.
a.definition: (interjektion) aha, oh, ha, öh, eh, oj; (partikel) [kommer efter något för betoning eller som känsla]

akesi.commentary: akesi brukade betyda "ogulligt djur", och definieras på detta sätt i pu, men den definitionen föll ur bruk och togs senare bort i pu-kommentarerna som publicerades med ku.
akesi.definition: reptil, groddjur, djur med fjäll, djur som kryper

ala.definition: inte, inget, nej; (partikel) [negerar ett ord eller en fras]; (partikel) [bildar en ja-eller-nejfråga]; (siffra) noll

alasa.commentary: I vissa sammanhang är användningen av "alasa" som ett förverb i betydelsen "att försöka" lika stor eller till och med större än "lukin". I pu har bara "lukin"/"oko" den betydelsen.
alasa.definition: jaga, plocka (bär, svamp, etc.), samla, leta efter, försök; (pv.) att försöka
alasa.etymology: à la chasse: Akadisk franska, jakt, (bokstavligen) på jakt

ale.commentary:
"ali" är ett alternativ till "ale", myntat i en enkät 2002 för att undvika förvirring med "ala". Användningen av "ale" i stället för "ali" är dock fortfarande vanligare.
Majoriteten av talarna säger att de inte förstår "riklig, överflödig" innebörden, åtminstone utan sammanhang.
"20, 120" var icke-pu betydelser som tidigare användes tillsammans med 100; de är praktiskt taget okända nuförtiden.
ale.definition: allt, alla, varje, helhet, universum; (siffra) ett hundra

ali.commentary: "ali" is an alternative to "ale", coined in a poll in 2002 in order to avoid confusion with "ala". However, the usage of "ale" over "ali" has been more common since at least the release of pu. Generally not considered a word in its own right.

anpa.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "anpa" has the meaning of "place that is down". In pu, "noka" has that meaning instead.
anpa.definition: botten, undersida; under, nedanför; besegrad, ödmjuk, lågmäld

ante.definition: annorlunda, förändrad; ändra, förändra, modifiera; annan, skillnad

anu.commentary: The usage of "anu" as a content word meaning "choose" remains controversial.
anu.definition: (partikel) [separerar flera möjligheter, ersätter en annan partikel], eller

apeja.commentary: According to jan Sonja, "apeja" never appeared in any pre-pu toki pona dictionary made by her and never promoted by her, instead it may have been "just an experimental idea in a forum post".
apeja.definition: skuld, skam, undvika, stigma; att anklaga, att peka ut, att avslöja, att vanära, att genera

awen.definition: stanna, vänta, pausa; skydda, beskydda; fortsätta; (pv.) att fortsätta
awen.etymology: houden: Nederländska, keep, care for, hold (in a particular state)

en.commentary: There are various analyses of the syntactic role of "en". Originally intended to be used as "and", it was changed (via poll in 2002) to just be used with "head nouns". One of the more recent analyses (including 2021's April Fools) treats "en" as a subject marker.

esun.commentary: According to jan Sonja, "esun was told [to her] by a taxi driver who spoke a language from the Akan family in West Africa".
esun.definition: handel, byteshandel, utbyte, köpa, sälja; marknad, affär, mässa, basar, affärsplats

ijo.definition: sak, ting, objekt, enhet, varelse, materia, fenomen
ijo.etymology: io: Esperanto, something; i-: Romance, (relative pronoun root)

ike.definition: av negativ kvalitet, t.ex. dålig, obehaglig, skadlig, onödig

insa.definition: insida, center, mellan, mitt, mittpunkt, intern, inre
insa.etymology: insait: Tok Pisin, inside, center, stomach; inside: Engelska, inside

isipin.definition: att tänka, brainstorma, rationalisera, dra slutsats, fundera

jaki.definition: äckligt, orent, ohygieniskt, giftigt, motbjudante, ruttet

jami.definition: mums; framkalla eller stimulera en positiv sensorisk upplevelse

jan.commentary: There are two sides to the concept, "sentient entity" and "homo sapiens", which matters for whether to use the word in edge cases (i.e. aliens, humans turned into werewolves, etc). Which sense is more central to the word remains controversial.

jelo.commentary: Some extend "jelo" to include lime green, but this usage is uncommon.

jonke.commentary: Coined in reference to the Untitled Goose Game fandom.

kala.definition: fisk, marint djur, havsdjur, simmande varelser

kalama.definition: Att ge ifrån sig ljud; ljud, t.ex. sjunga, åska, trumma, klappa, skratta, pip
kalama.etymology: галама (galama): Serbokroatiska, noise (of the human voice)

kama.definition: arriving, coming, future, summoned; (preverb) to become, manage to, succeed in
kama.etymology: kamap: Tok Pisin, event, arrive, happen, become, bring about, summon

kamalawala.commentary: The word is from a story called "jan pi Kamalawala". A character's name is described as "nimi Jan pi Kama e Lawa Ala", and a shortened version given as "nimi Kamalawala". jan Kipo is responsible for it becoming a word instead of just a name.
kamalawala.etymology: kama pi lawa ala: toki pona, 'arrival of no government', the beginning of anarchy

kapesi.etymology: 咖啡色 (gaa³ fe¹ sik¹): Kantonesiska, brown, coffee (colour); 咖啡色 (kāfēisè): Mandarin, brown, coffee (colour)

ken.definition: kan, får, förmåga, tillåtelse; möjlighet, kanske; tillåta, göra möjlig; (pv.) att kunna
ken.etymology: ken: Tok Pisin, can; can: Engelska, can

kepeken.commentary: Whether "kepeken" should be used with or without "e" in a predicative position (meaning "to use") remains controversial.

kijetesantakalu.commentary: Coined as an April Fools joke in 2009.
kijetesantakalu.definition: tvättbjörn, veckelbjörn (kinkajou); något djur i familjen Halvbjörnar (Procyonidae); något djur i överfamiljen Musteloidea

kiki.commentary: The word is loaned from the 2001 Vilanyur S Ramachandran & Edward Hubbard version of Wolfgang Köhler's 1912 psycholinguistic experiment. The experiment studied sound symbolism on the words "bouba" and "kiki".

kili.commentary: In post-ku 2021, metaphorical definitions for kili have been suggested, including but not limited to "offspring" and "product", and are moderately popular. It is not yet clear whether this will remain in use long-term.

kin.commentary:
In common usage (both before and after pu), "a" and "kin" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms.
Underwent significant changes in usage in 2002, alongside "en" and (now obsolete) "kan".
kin.definition: (particle) [after phrase or at sentence start] too, also, as well, additionally

kipisi.definition: split, cut, slice; piece, part; sharp, pointy

kiwen.commentary: This word was coined in a poll in 2002, replacing the compound phrase "wawa ma".
kiwen.definition: hard object e.g. metal, stone, wood

ko.commentary: The "clinging form" definition was elaborated to mean "a shape or mass that sticks or clings; a clot, a thick or viscous lump, a clump that can be reshaped".
ko.definition: semi-solid, e.g. paste, powder, goo, sand, soil, clay; squishy, moldable; sticky

kokosila.commentary: In Esperanto, "krokodili" means "to speak among Esperantists in a language besides Esperanto," and is an established bit of Esperanto culture.
kokosila.definition: att prata något annat språk än Toki Pona i ett sammanhang där Toki Pona hade varit mer lämpligt
kokosila.etymology: krokodilas: Esperanto, to speak among Esperantists in a language other than Esperanto; krokodilo: Esperanto, crocodile

kon.definition: air, breath, wind; essence, spirit, soul, ghost; unseen agent
kon.etymology: 空氣 (kōngqì): Mandarin, air, atmosphere, ambience, opinion

konwe.commentary:
Conway hänvisar till John Horton Conway, skapare av den cellulära automatan Game of Life.
"konwe"s avsedda betydelse sträcker sig bortom bara "levande" och "liv". Den kan användas för att beskriva stenar eller floder eller andra icke-levande saker
konwe.definition: animacitet, liv; autonom varelse, levande ting, organism; levande, dynamisk; att ge liv åt, att väcka liv i
konwe.etymology: Conway: Engelska, John Conway, creator of The Game of Life; kon wile: toki pona, kon wile

ku.commentary: Se den officiella Toki Pona-hemsidan för sätt att köpa boken.
ku.definition: interacting with the book Toki Pona Dictionary (2021) by Sonja Lang

kule.commentary: in addition to its pu-definitions, kule is sometimes used to talk about more general kinds of categories, like type, kind, flavour, gender, etc.
kule.definition: color, pigment; category, genre, flavor; colorful, diverse

kulijo.definition: (interjection) [casually express appreciation or acknowledgement]; cool, fine, okay

kulupu.definition: group, community, society, company, nation, collection, team, crowd
kulupu.etymology: kulupu: Tonganska, group; group: Engelska, group

kute.definition: ear, hearing organ; hear, listen, pay attention to, obey

la.definition: (particle) [mark the previous statement as context to the following statement]
la.etymology: la: Esperanto, (definite article); la: Romance, (feminine singular definite article); -la: Akadisk franska, (proximal & topical suffix)

lanpan.etymology: λαμβάνω (lamváno): Greek, take, seize, grasp, receive

lape.definition: sleep, rest, break from an activity or work

laso.definition: turquoise, blue, green, cyan, indigo, lime green
laso.etymology: glas: Welsh, blue, inexperienced; glas: Proto-Brythonic, green, blue

lawa.definition: head, mind, brain; control, lead, guide; government, leader; rule, law

leko.definition: square, cube, block, blocky object e.g. bricks, stairs
leko.etymology: Lego: Engelska, Lego; leg godt: Danska, play well; lohko: Finska, block, section

len.definition: cloth, clothing, fabric, textile; covered, hidden, secret, private

lete.definition: cold, cool, frozen; freeze, chill; raw, uncooked
lete.etymology: frette: Akadisk franska, cold; freit: Old French, cold

li.definition: (particle) [marks the start of an indicative verb (statement)]
li.etymology: li: Esperanto, he; ille: Latin, he; i: Tok Pisin, he; he: Engelska, he

lili.definition: small, short, young; few; piece, part
lili.etymology: liklik: Tok Pisin, small, little; liklik: Ramoaaina, small, little

linja.definition: long, flexible thing, e.g. rope, yarn, hair, fur, line, strand
linja.etymology: linja: Finska, line; linia: Fornsvenska, line

linluwi.definition: bonded things which are stronger through their bonds e.g. network, internet, connection; weave, braid, interlace

lipu.definition: flat and bendable object, e.g. paper, card, leaf; written text or document, e.g. book, website, clay tablet

loje.definition: red, magenta, scarlet, pink, rust-colored, reddish orange

lon.definition: present, existing, real, true; (preposition) located at, in, during, in the context of
lon.etymology: long: Tok Pisin, at, in, on, (spacial particle); along: Engelska, along

luka.definition: hand, arm, tactile limb, grasping limb; to grasp, interact with, feel using touch; (number) five

lukin.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "lukin" and "oko" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "oko" at all, preferring "lukin" in all circumstances. The usage of "alasa" as a preverb meaning "try to" is more common than "lukin". In pu, only "lukin" has this meaning. A very common beginner mistake is treating "lukin" as if it means "appearance", due to the mistakenly equating the "visual" meaning as in "pona lukin (visually good)" to mean "looks good".
lukin.definition: see, look, view, examine, read, watch; visual; eye, seeing organ; (preverb) try to
lukin.etymology: lukim: Tok Pisin, see, look at; look: Engelska, look; him: Engelska, him

lupa.definition: hole, pit, cave, doorway, window, portal
lupa.etymology: clupa: Lojban, loop; 圈 (quān): Mandarin, loop; loop: Engelska, loop; पाश (pāś): Hindi, loop; أنشوطة‏ (anšūṭa): Arabic, loop

ma.definition: earth, land, soil; country, territory, world; outdoors

majuna.etymology: maljuna: Esperanto, old (not young); malus: Latin, bad; jung: German, young; jeune: Franska, young

mama.definition: parent, ancestor; creator, originator; caretaker, sustainer, guardian

mani.definition: money, currency; thing of value e.g. gold, investment, livestock
mani.etymology: money: Engelska, money; fehu: Proto-Germanic, livestock; pecū: Latin, cattle

meli.etymology: meri: Tok Pisin, woman, wife, feminine; mari: Tolai, pretty; Mary: Engelska, Mary

melome.etymology: meli pi olin meli: toki pona, women loving women

meso.definition: medelpunkt, medium, medioker, medelmåttig; varken det ena eller det andra

mi.etymology: mi: Esperanto, I, me; m-: Romance, (1st person singular oblique)

mijomi.etymology: mije pi olin mije: toki pona, men loving men

misa.definition: gruppen Glires (gnagare och hardjur) eller Eulipotyphla (äkta insektsätare); råtta, mus, ekorre, kanin, gnagare {~ suli} kapybara

misikeke.commentary: The word was used privately by jan Sonja up until November 2019, when she mentioned it in the ma pona pi toki pona discord server as a word she was experimenting with. It is believed the word was originally coined in 2007-2009 alongside pan, esun, apeja, monsuta, and pu, but this cannot be proven.
misikeke.definition: medical item or practice e.g. prescriptions, meditation, exercise, bandages, therapy

moku.definition: eat, drink, consume, swallow, ingest; food, edible thing

moli.definition: death, dead, die, dying; kill, murder

monsi.etymology: mon tchu: Akadisk franska, my ass (vulgar)

monsuta.definition: fear, nervousness, dread; scary, frightening; scary thing e.g. predator, threat, danger
monsuta.etymology: モンスター (monsutā): Japanska, monster; monster: Engelska, monster

mun.definition: moon, night sky object, star, celestial body

musi.definition: fun, game, entertainment, art, play, amusing, interesting, comical, silly
musi.etymology: amuzi: Esperanto, amuse, entertain; amuser: Franska, amuse, entertain

mute.etymology: multe: Esperanto, a lot; multus: Latin, a lot

n.definition: (interjection) hm, uh, mm, er, umm, [indicate thinking or pause]

namako.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "sin" and "namako" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "namako" at all, preferring "sin" in all circumstances.
namako.etymology: नमक (namak): Hindi, salt; نمک (namak): Persian, salt

nanpa.etymology: namba: Tok Pisin, number; number: Engelska, number

nasa.definition: strange, unusual, silly, abnormal, unexpected; drunk, intoxicated

nasin.definition: method, doctrine, tradition; path, road, way

nena.definition: protuberances e.g. bump, button, hill, nose

ni.etymology: 呢 (ni): Kantonesiska, this; 哩 (le): Tai, (continuation of a state/action)

nimisin.commentary: Mostly used in conversations in English. Likely was popularised by the :nimisin: emote in ma pona, which was originally used to notify Atawan (maintainer of "nimi ale") about newly coined words. In common speech, the meaning got extended to include most or all non-pu words, regardless if they were coined recently or not.
nimisin.definition: alla icke-pu ord; alla nya ord; alla skämtord
nimisin.etymology: nimi sin: toki pona, new word

noka.commentary: noka can also mean any action involving the foot or leg, e.g. to kick, to step on, to touch with the leg.
noka.definition: foot, leg, organ of locomotion, roots

o.definition: (particle) [marks the end of a vocative (who is being spoken to)], [marks the start of an imperative (command, wish, instruction)], should

ojuta.definition: adaptation of the English meme "ligma", (literally) "o uta" (lick)
ojuta.etymology: o uta: toki pona, 'lick my balls' (same as English 'ligma balls')

oko.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "lukin" and "oko" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "oko" at all, preferring "lukin" in all circumstances, though some speakers do the opposite and use "oko" exclusively instead.
oko.definition: see, look, view, examine, read, watch; visual; eye, seeing organ; (preverb) try to

olin.commentary: In english, "love" can be used to mean "like a lot", but in toki pona, "olin" doesn't work that way. It indicates an emotional connection or bond, not preference
olin.definition: to have a strong emotional bond with, e.g. affection, appreciation, compassion, respect; platonic, romantic, or familial relationships

omekapo.commentary: Coined by jan Maliku in reference to the message "o moku e kala pona", which jan Sonja wrote on their copy of Toki Pona: The Language of Good during a Texas meetup.
omekapo.definition: goodbye, farewell, see you later, (literally) "o moku e kala pona" (eat a good fish)
omekapo.etymology: o moku e kala pona: toki pona, 'eat a good fish', wishing somebody well

ona.commentary: This word was coined in a poll in 2002. It replaced "iki", which was deemed too similar-sounding to "ike". Other options in the poll included "ipi" and "i".

open.commentary: Some proficient speakers use open as a preverb that means "start to," that goes along with the complimentary pini preverb "to stop"
open.definition: begin, start, open, turn on; beginning

owe.definition: totalitarian, Orwellian; of or relating to Big Brother from the book Ninety Eighty-Four
owe.etymology: Orwell: Engelska, George Orwell, author of 1984

pakala.definition: damaged, broken, botched, harmed, messed up; mistake
pakala.etymology: bagarap: Tok Pisin, accident; bugger up: Engelska, bugger up

pake.definition: stoppa, avbryta; att blockera; att förhindra

pakola.etymology: pakala: toki pona, broken, damaged, harmed, destroyed

pali.definition: work, activity; create, build, design; put effort toward, take action on

palisa.definition: long and hard thing e.g. branch, pole, rod, stick, spine, mast

pan.definition: grains, starchy foods, baked goods e.g. rice, sorghum, bread, noodles, masa, porridge, injera
pan.etymology: pan: Romance, bread; パン (pan): Japanska, bread; pão: Portuguese, bread

pana.definition: att ge, skicka, avge, förse, ställa, släppa
pana.etymology: panna: Finska, put, set, place; pana: swahili, give to each other

penpo.commentary: Myntad med hänvisning till ma pona pi toki ponas "tenpo pi toki pona taso"-event, och förkortat till "tenpo penpo".
penpo.etymology: (pi) toki pona taso: toki pona, only toki pona

pi.commentary: The usage of "pi" to mean "of" (marking a possessor) is heavily discouraged nowadays, preferring it to only be used for regrouping within phrases.
pi.definition: (particle) [group the following words into one modifier for the previous word]
pi.etymology: bilong: Tok Pisin, of; belong: Engelska, belong

pika.definition: elektrisk, elektronisk, ledande, mekanisk, online; elektricitet, blixt, åska, nätverk
pika.etymology: ピカチュウ (Pikachū): Japanska, Pikachū, an electric Pokémon

pilin.definition: experience e.g. emotion, feeling, touch; heart (physical or emotional)
pilin.etymology: pilim: Tok Pisin, feel; -im: Engelska, him; him: Engelska, him

pimeja.definition: dark, unlit; dark color, e.g. black, purple, brown

pini.commentary: Some proficient speakers use pini as a preverb that means "to stop," that goes along with the complimentary open preverb "start to"
pini.definition: finish, stop, prevent; close, disable, turn off; ended, past; edge, end, conclusion
pini.etymology: fini: Akadisk franska, finished, completed; pinis: Tok Pisin, finish (perfective aspect); finish: Engelska, finish

pipi.definition: insect, bug, spider, tiny crawling creature

poka.definition: hip, side; next to, nearby, vicinity

poki.commentary: poki is sometimes used as "category" or to express types of things. One example is roles or groups, in discord chat contexts
poki.definition: container e.g. bag, bowl, box, cup, cupboard, drawer, folder
poki.etymology: bokis: Tok Pisin, box, female genitalia (vulgar); box: Engelska, box

pona.definition: positive quality, e.g. good, pleasant, helpful, friendly, useful, peaceful

powe.etymology: pas vrai: Akadisk franska, not true

pu.commentary: Se den officiella Toki Pona-hemsidan för sätt att köpa boken.
pu.definition: interacting with the book Toki Pona: The Language of Good by Sonja Lang
pu.etymology: 樸 (pǔ): Mandarin, unworked wood, sincere, honest, inherent quality, simple; book: Engelska, book

puwa.definition: fluffig, mjuk (något som kan bli ihoptryckt och kommer försöka återgå till sin ursprungliga form)
puwa.etymology: ふわふわ (fuwafuwa): Japanska, fluffy things (onomatopoeia)

sama.definition: same, similar, alike; (adjective) peer, fellow, each other; (preposition) similar to, same as
sama.etymology: sama: Finska, same; *samaz: Proto-Germanic, same, alike; sama: Esperanto, same; same: Engelska, same

san.commentary:
More popular than the synonymous (and older) tuli.
san was also part of a set of 10 digit words created by jan Lenoka: lenke, jatu, ini, san, se, nun, loku, take, patu, kajo (0 through 9). All of these coinages except for san lack notability to be included in the main dictionary. They can be found in the sandbox.
san.etymology: 三 (san): Japanska, (number) three; 三 (sāam): Kantonesiska, (number) three; 叁 (sāam): Kantonesiska, (number) three

seli.commentary: In pu, definitions of seli are described as adjectives. ku's pu corrections clarify that these refer to nouns instead.
seli.definition: hot, warm; heat, fire, flame; burn

selo.definition: outer layer, e.g. skin, peel, shell, bark; outer shape, outer form, boundary
selo.etymology: ŝelo: Esperanto, skin, peel; schale: German, peel, husk, shell

seme.definition: (particle) [indicate a question by marking missing info in a sentence]; what, which, who

sewi.definition: up, top, above, highest part; divine, sacred, supernatural; awesome, inspiring, excelling

sijelo.definition: body, shape, physical state, torso, substance, form

sike.definition: circle, sphere, spiral, round thing e.g. ball, wheel; repeating thing e.g. cycle, orbit, loop

sin.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "sin" and "namako" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "namako" at all, preferring "sin" in all circumstances.
sin.definition: new, fresh, update; repeat, do again

sinpin.definition: vertical surface e.g. wall, board; front of something e.g. face
sinpin.etymology: 前邊 (tsin bin): Kantonesiska, in front

sitelen.definition: bild, fotografi, avbildning, symbol, tecken, skrift

sona.definition: knowledge, information, data; know, be skilled in, be wise about; (preverb) know how to

soweli.etymology: ცხოველი (cxoveli): Georgiska, beastly animal, lively, passionate

su.commentary: This word was originally coined in ku as a reserved word for jan Sonja's future use. It was redefined upon the release of the first su book, making its status as a ku word debatable.
su.definition: interagera med en bok ur Sonja Langs illustrerade bokserie, som började med Trollkarlen från Oz

suli.definition: big, heavy, large, long, tall, wide; important, relevant

suno.definition: light, shine, glow, radiance; sun, light source; brightness

supa.definition: flat horizontal surface, especially to put or rest things on e.g. bed, floor, desk, plate, table, platform, stage
supa.etymology: surfaco: Esperanto, surface; surface: Akadisk franska, surface; surface: Engelska, surface

sutopatikuna.commentary: Coined by Alexandre Baudry in 2009 in response to jan Sonja coining "kijetesantakalu" as part of 2009's April Fools.
sutopatikuna.etymology: čudnovati kljunaš: Serbokroatiska, platypus, (literally) strange beak

suwi.etymology: swit: Tok Pisin, sweet; sweet: Engelska, sweet

taki.definition: klibbigt, magnetiskt; förbindelse, attrahera, fästa, gem
taki.etymology: 탁 (tag): Koreanska, the sound of two magnets hitting each other (onomatopoeia)

taso.commentary: Some proficient speakers use taso as a connector between sentences (X taso Y), similar to "X, but Y," as though taso behaved like la grammatically.
taso.definition: only, exclusively; (particle) [marks a sentence as qualifying or contradictory], but, however
taso.etymology: tasol: Tok Pisin, just, only, but, however; that’s all: Engelska, that’s all

tawa.definition: motion, e.g. walking, shaking, flight, travel; (preposition) to, for, going to, from the perspective of

te.commentary: May be paired with "to", or used on its own. It is unclear how accepted either approach is among te / to users.

telo.definition: liquids e.g. water, gasoline, soda, lava, soup, oil, ink

tenpo.definition: tid, händelse, situation, tillfälle, period, varaktighet
tenpo.etymology: tempo: Esperanto, tid; tempus: Latin, tid

to.commentary: May be paired with "te", or used on its own. It is unclear how accepted either approach is among te / to users.

toki.definition: communicate, say, think; conversation, story; language
toki.etymology: tok: Tok Pisin, talk; talk: Engelska, talk

tomo.definition: indoor space or shelter e.g. room, building, home, tent, shack
tomo.etymology: domo: Esperanto, house; dom: Polish, house; domus: Latin, house; δόμος: Klassisk grekiska, house

tonsi.commentary:
* - Broader in meaning, somewhat less commonly accepted.
Widely regarded in the community to be a crucial addition to toki pona. Occasionally referred to as an "honorary pu word" to highlight its status, or equated to a pu word outright.
tonsi.etymology: 同志 (tóngzhì): Mandarin, comrade (same will/purpose), LGBT+

tu.etymology: two: Engelska, two; du: Esperanto, two

unpa.commentary: Also defined as "have marital relations with" in pu; removed due to potential confusion.

usawi.commentary: Originally, usawi also included "technology so complex it's impossible to tell apart from magic" in its meaning, but this meaning has been deprecated by the creator.
usawi.definition: magi, häxkonst, trolldom; förtrollad, magisk, övernaturlig, ockult, oförståligt

uta.commentary: The dot in the "uta" sitelen pona is to distinguish luka-uta from moku.

utala.definition: kämpa, tävla, strida; tävling, utmaning; kamp, strävan

wa.commentary: Sometimes analyzed as a variety of "a".

wan.definition: (siffra) ett; singular; kombinera, sammanfoga, blanda, smälta samman

wasoweli.commentary: First used as the name for a species in a mod for Caves of Qud created by akesi kon Nalasuni. Later appeared in ku as exclusively part of a translation for "penguin".
wasoweli.definition: djur med egenskaper av både waso och soweli
wasoweli.etymology: waso: toki pona, bird, flying creature; soweli: toki pona, land animal, fuzzy creature

wawa.definition: kraft, energi, styrka; självsäker, intensiv, kraftfull; fantastisk, imponerande

weka.definition: frånvarande, borta, avlägsen; ta bort, bli av med

wekama.definition: lämna och komma tillbaka, vara temporärt frånvarande med avsikten att återvända
wekama.etymology: weka kama: toki pona, 'leave-arrive', to leave and come back

wuwojiti.commentary: May be seen not as a word in toki pona, but as a kind of memorisation tool in English to refer to the "banned" syllables. Occasionally extended to wuwojitinmanna to include the illegal consecutive nasal consonants.
wuwojiti.definition: att använda en eller fler av de förbjudna stavelserna wu, wo, ji eller ti; att bryta mot Toki Ponas fonotax
wuwojiti.etymology: wu: toki pona, (sound); wo: toki pona, (sound); ji: toki pona, (sound); ti: toki pona, (sound)

yupekosi.commentary: Coined as a random keystroke. It is presumed jan Sonja used "y" by mistake, but then made it part of the joke by adding "nobody knows how to pronounce the y".
yupekosi.definition: att uppföra sig som George Lucas och revidera dina gamla kreativa verk och faktiskt göra dem sämre
